item.title: Seven Pacific Jeans factories to reopen Thursday after weeklong closure
item.description: Seven factories of Pacific Jeans Group, one of the country's leading garment exporters, are set to reopen tomorrow (Thursday) following a week-long closure due to “attacks on factories and poor working conditions.” The information was confirmed in a company notice signed by Managing Di

item.title: 63 killed in Uganda bus crash
item.description: A road accident involving two buses on one of Uganda's busiest highways killed at least 63 people and left others injured, police said on Wednesday. The crash happened just after midnight on the highway between the capital Kampala and the northern city of Gulu, reports Reuters. Initial investigat

item.title: Dhaka Metro to charge commuters Tk 100 for entry to stations without travel
item.description: Commuters who enter any metro rail station in Dhaka by scanning their card but leave without making a trip will be charged a Tk 100 penalty, authorities say. The rule has been introduced by the Dhaka Mass Transit Company Limited (DMTCL). Notices announcing the change have been posted at several s

item.title: BNP sought impartial role, not caretaker govt: Law Adviser
item.description: BNP has not demanded a caretaker government but rather sought an impartial role from the current interim government during the next national election, said Law Affairs Adviser Asif Nazrul. Talking to reporters at the Secretariat, the adviser clarified that during Tuesday’s meeting between th
